page.title: 13Housing In High Park
page.content: In our area there are three types of housing and most of the houses are over 100 years old.Most of them are semi-detached,brick-built, slate-roofed and two storey. Many of them have had their sash windows replaced by double-glazing.These houses are mostly privately owned. Secondly, there is an entire street of about sixty prefabs.The walls are wood and concrete, the roofs are corrugated asbestos and they are all bungalows built in 1941 for Liverpool evacuees. They were intended to last 20 years, but are still rented and lived in.The newest houses were built by the council in the 1950's. They are mainly semi's with a few terraces.They are brick-built with tiled roofs and are rented.
